every.title: JavaScript Practice Task - every Method
every.description: Your task is to write a function that checks if all elements in an array are greater than 10. Use the JavaScript every method to accomplish this.
every.example: For the input [11, 12, 15, 20], the result should be true. For [5, 12, 15], the result should be false.

concat.title: JavaScript Practice Task - concat Method
concat.description: Your task is to write a function that concatenates two arrays using the concat method.
concat.example: For the input [1, 2] and [3, 4], the result should be [1, 2, 3, 4].

find.title: JavaScript Practice Task - find Method
find.description: Your task is to write a function that finds the first element in an array that is greater than 10 using the find method.
find.example: For the input [5, 12, 8], the result should be 12.

pop.title: JavaScript Practice Task - pop Method
pop.description: Your task is to write a function that removes the last element from an array using the pop method.
pop.example: For the input [1, 2, 3], the result should be [1, 2] and the removed element should be 3.

push.title: JavaScript Practice Task - push Method
push.description: Your task is to write a function that adds an element to the end of an array using the push method.
push.example: For the input [1, 2] and 3, the result should be [1, 2, 3].

reverse.title: JavaScript Practice Task - reverse Method
reverse.description: Your task is to write a function that reverses the elements in an array using the reverse method.
reverse.example: For the input [1, 2, 3], the result should be [3, 2, 1].

shift.title: JavaScript Practice Task - shift Method
shift.description: Your task is to write a function that removes the first element from an array using the shift method.
shift.example: For the input [1, 2, 3], the result should be [2, 3] and the removed element should be 1.

unshift.title: JavaScript Practice Task - unshift Method
unshift.description: Your task is to write a function that adds an element to the beginning of an array using the unshift method.
unshift.example: For the input [2, 3] and 1, the result should be [1, 2, 3].

slice.title: JavaScript Practice Task - slice Method
slice.description: Your task is to write a function that returns a portion of an array using the slice method.
slice.example: For the input [1, 2, 3, 4] and 1, 3, the result should be [2, 3].

sort.title: JavaScript Practice Task - sort Method
sort.description: Your task is to write a function that sorts an array in ascending order using the sort method.
sort.example: For the input [3, 1, 2], the result should be [1, 2, 3].

splice.title: JavaScript Practice Task - splice Method
splice.description: Your task is to write a function that removes elements from an array using the splice method.
splice.example: For the input [1, 2, 3, 4], start at index 1 and remove 2 items, the result should be [1, 4].

includes.title: JavaScript Practice Task - includes Method
includes.description: Your task is to write a function that checks if an array includes a specified value using the includes method.
includes.example: For the input [1, 2, 3] and 2, the result should be true.

join.title: JavaScript Practice Task - join Method
join.description: Your task is to write a function that joins all elements of an array into a string using the join method.
join.example: For the input [1, 2, 3] and '-', the result should be '1-2-3'.

forEach.title: JavaScript Practice Task - forEach Method
forEach.description: Your task is to write a function that iterates over an array and logs each element using the forEach method.
forEach.example: For the input [1, 2, 3], it should log 1, 2, 3.

filter.title: JavaScript Practice Task - filter Method
filter.description: Your task is to write a function that filters elements greater than 10 from an array using the filter method.
filter.example: For the input [5, 12, 8, 20], the result should be [12, 20].

flat.title: JavaScript Practice Task - flat Method
flat.description: Your task is to write a function that flattens a nested array by one level using the flat method.
flat.example: For the input [1, [2, 3], [4, 5]], the result should be [1, 2, 3, 4, 5].

flatMap.title: JavaScript Practice Task - flatMap Method
flatMap.description: Your task is to write a function that maps and flattens elements of an array by one level using the flatMap method.
flatMap.example: For the input [1, 2, 3], mapping each element to an array of itself, the result should be [1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 3].

map.title: JavaScript Practice Task - map Method
map.description: Your task is to write a function that doubles each element in an array using the map method.
map.example: For the input [1, 2, 3], the result should be [2, 4, 6].

some.title: JavaScript Practice Task - some Method
some.description: Your task is to write a function that checks if any element in an array is greater than 10 using the some method.
some.example: For the input [5, 12, 8], the result should be true.

reduce.title: JavaScript Practice Task - reduce Method
reduce.description: Your task is to write a function that calculates the sum of elements in an array using the reduce method.
reduce.example: For the input [1, 2, 3], the result should be 6.

reverseString.title: JavaScript Practice Task - Reverse a String
reverseString.description: Your task is to write a function that reverses a given string.
reverseString.example: For the input 'hello', the result should be 'olleh'.
